SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: Oh dear, more Snowden revelations as a new batch of NSA documents and intercepts have been made public.

Today, 23 June 2015, WikiLeaks began publishing "Espionnage Élysée", a collection of TOP SECRET intelligence reports and technical documents from the US National Security Agency (NSA) concerning targeting and signals intelligence intercepts of the communications of high-level officials from successive French governments over the last ten years.

The top secret documents derive from directly targeted NSA surveillance of the communications of French Presidents Francois Hollande (2012–present), Nicolas Sarkozy (2007–2012), and Jacques Chirac (1995–2007), as well as French cabinet ministers and the French Ambassador to the United States. The documents also contain the "selectors" from the target list, detailing the cell phone numbers of numerous officials in the Elysee up to and including the direct cell phone of the President.
Is this really surprising? Of course not. The French would have to be fools not to have known they were being spied upon by Uncle Sam.

It was widely known that the US had eavesdropped on Chirac. The well was poisoned when Bush found out what Chirac and the French had been saying about him in the run up to the Iraq war. No surprise, but it wasn't very flattering to Bush.
It comes as no surprise that Sarkozy and Hollande were also spied on. There are probably very few world leaders that weren't spied on.
There was no need to spy on Irish leaders as Gilmore would regularly update the US ambassador in person.

Our leadership are too boring to be spied on.

Well, I reckon "useless" is probably more descriptive and relevant in this scenario......
And in other news, bears found to be prone to defecating in sylvan settings and Pope Francis revealed to be a Catholic.

Tricky dicky, tapes a couple of phones and resigns, Obama tapes the world and gets away with it, funny that
France is still a major player on the world stage. No surprise the USA is keeping tabs on them.

Some Irish like to think that we are the centre of the universe, that the rest of the world is hanging onto our every word. Truth is Ireland is irrelevant. We are not worth spying on, a waste of resources. This is why I cringe when Paul Murphy and co pontificate on worldly matters such as Israel and Palestine...as if his opinion matters or if anyone is even listening.
They should expel the U.S. Ambassador. Show up Merkel for being weak when they did the same.
